H0.text: According to Greek myth, who was the wife of Odysseus, celebrated for her faithfulness to him during his twenty year absence. Helen

H1.text: According to Greek myth, who was the wife of Odysseus, celebrated for her faithfulness to him during his twenty year absence. Andromache

H2.text: According to Greek myth, who was the wife of Odysseus, celebrated for her faithfulness to him during his twenty year absence. Ariadne

H3.text: According to Greek myth, who was the wife of Odysseus, celebrated for her faithfulness to him during his twenty year absence. PENELOPE

A4.text: Penelope is married to the main character, the king of Ithaca, Odysseus (Ulysses in Roman mythology), and daughter of Icarius of Sparta and Periboea (or Polycaste).

A5.text: She waits twenty years for Odysseus's return, during which time she devises various cunning strategies to delay marrying any of the 108 suitors (led by Antinous and including Agelaus, Amphinomus, Ctessippus, Demoptolemus, Elatus, Euryades, Eurymachus and Peisander).
